name: Lead-Lag Compensator
latex: G_c(s) = K\frac{s + z}{s + p}, \quad \text{Lead: } z < p, \quad \text{Lag: } z > p
explanation: Compensators improve system performance. Lead compensator (z < p) increases phase margin, improves transient response, speeds up system. Lag compensator (z > p) improves steady-state accuracy, reduces steady-state error. Used when simple PID tuning isn't sufficient. Lead-lag combines both effects. Essential for advanced control system design.

examples.problem: Lead compensator: G_c(s) = (s + 1)/(s + 10). What does it do?
examples.solution: Increases phase margin, speeds up response

examples.problem: Lag compensator: G_c(s) = (s + 10)/(s + 1). What does it do?
examples.solution: Reduces steady-state error, improves low-frequency response
